sentences: Bruce Forman (born 1956) is an American jazz guitarist.

In 1971, his family moved to San Francisco, where he led his own groups in the area and performed with local jazz musicians, such as Eddie Duran, Vince Lateano, and Eddie Marshall, and with nationally known musicians, such as Ray Brown, George Cables, Joe Henderson, Freddie Hubbard, Bobby Hutcherson, and Woody Shaw.
He played with Richie Cole from 1978 to 1982.
His most successful album as a leader was 1992's Forman on the Job, which hit #14 on the U.S. Billboard Top Jazz Albums chart.
Forman on the Job with Joe Henderson (Kamei, 1992)
The Sound of Music with Michele Weir (Weirforman/CD Baby, 2003)
Ray Brown, Some of My Best Friends Are...Guitarists (Telarc, 2002)
Bobby Enriquez & Richie Cole, The Wildman Meets the Madman (GNP Crescendo, 1982)
Johnny Griffin & Richie Cole, Jazz Life Vol. 1 (Storyville, 2003)
Kristin Korb, What's Your Story (Double K Music, 2013)
Lanny Morgan, It's About Time (Palo Alto, 1985)
Ilya Serov, Back in Time (Silky Sound, 2018)
